description: Indulge in the irresistible combination of sweet and spicy with this Korean-inspired gochujang caramel popcorn. Perfect for movie nights or as a unique snack at gatherings, this recipe will elevate your popcorn game to a whole new level!
instructions: Pop the popcorn kernels using an air popper or stovetop method and set aside in a large bowl.
In a saucepan, combine sugar, butter, gochujang, and salt over medium heat, stirring until the mixture comes to a boil.
Let the caramel boil for 4-5 minutes without stirring until it turns a deep amber color.
Pour the caramel over the popped popcorn and stir well to coat evenly.
Spread the coated popcorn onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and let it cool before serving.
tips: For a crunchier texture, bake the coated popcorn in a preheated oven at 250°F for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.

Preparation:

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Watch the caramel closely to prevent burning; the color change is key.
  • A common mistake is stirring the caramel while it boils; let it sit for perfect texture.
  • Popcorn is ready when it’s fully coated and cooled, ensuring it’s crispy.
  • Store in an airtight container for up to a week for best freshness.

structured_content.content: This popcorn has become a favorite among my friends and family. Sharing it during movie nights has created wonderful memories, and I love seeing their reactions to the unique flavor!
For an extra kick, consider adding a sprinkle of sesame seeds or chopped peanuts for added texture and flavor. You can also experiment with different types of chili paste for varying heat levels.
This popcorn pairs wonderfully with a refreshing drink like iced tea or lemonade. Serve it in fun bowls for parties or as a snack during game nights!
For a vegan version, substitute butter with coconut oil and use a plant-based sweetener. You can also try adding dried fruit for a sweet contrast to the spice.

  • For an impressive presentation, serve in clear containers to showcase the popcorn's vibrant color.
